---
title: Reticulospinal Tract 
---

The reticulospinal tract is an [extrapyramidal tract]({{< var ref-extrapyramidal-tracts.path >}}) that is part of the [medial motor systems]({{< var ref-medial-motor-systems.path >}}) which spans the entire spinal cord to function in [automatic posture]({{< var ref-posture.automatic >}}) and [gait-related movements]({{< var ref-gait.path >}}) @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022.


::: {.callout title="Muscle stretch reflex / tone"}

"where dorsal RST arises. Hence, the area of cerebellum inhibits muscle tone indirectly through inhibition of gamma motor" @gangulyMuscleTonePhysiology2021
:::

# Pathway

## Input

- Pontine
- Medullary reticular formation

## Pathway

- The reticulospinal tract decussates in the midbrain at the dorsal tegmental decussation @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022.
- The reticulospinal tract spans the entire spinal cord, travelling through the anterior horn 

![Somatotopic organization of medial and lateral motor system Projections to Anterior Horn Cells @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022](/The Archive/Neuroscience/Neuroanatomy/Tracts/images/fig.6.7 Blumenfeld somatotopic organization of medial and lateral motor systems.png)

## Output


# Function

- [automatic posture]({{< var ref-posture.automatic >}}) @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022
- [gait-related movements]({{< var ref-gait.path >}}) @blumenfeldNeuroanatomyClinicalCases2022


# Medial reticulospinal tract {#medial-reticulospinal-tract}

- AKA Ventral reticulospinal tract
- AKA Pontine reticulospinal tract

# Lateral reticulospinal tract {#lateral-reticulospinal-tract}
